E9CE5E6D308F4442900A4B41D881BE2E.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those
in need through Corporal and Spiritual Works of Mercy.

0B3CB968EB304BC2B155C70E933B6887.description:
The Magisterium has given us guidance in the form of encyclicals and
letters to help us live just lives.

1AFE16CDAD9B462192BB7630A67AE86E.description: The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to model our lives.

CC0A3A1AE6D141778FFCB4C9B381023A.description:
The Saints provide us with examples of how to live justly and with
compassion for others.

7F7A44D8CB57439D9D9C59697AD7CC1E.description: The Old Testament and New Testament both contain scriptural stories that guide the faithful in living lives of justice and mercy.

FB0EF9872588453DA0B415E1A246C714.description: The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the New Covenant.

F8F05EA66F51417BB989701F9BB67309.description:
JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS
DISCIPLES.

55CA0FB9045144DD8D6F640D2BA05484.description: The liturgy has undergone changes throughout the history of the Church in order to better serve the needs of the faithful.

6AA3BC5D7E0F499AA8EA0A480862B315.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and help the faithful to lead lives directed
towards Jesus Christ.

68945A8186D04CD087A1AD663067E133.description:
The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday Eucharistic
Celebration, the central liturgical action of the faithful.

1246956D75194978B8E8E01A6E0AF6DF.description:
The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to
sanctify our days.

B2C8F0F7CFED4E4EBD4E1E006EBFA09E.description:
The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work and prayer of the Liturgy of the Hours.
The Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of the Church,
prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

B14624F19CBF436088323F75B337E46B.description: LITURGY IS THE PUBLIC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THE CHURCH.

A55EF6BEE63442F182B066C4B9162FAB.description: The precepts of the Church are standards that Catholics observe to live a Christian life in the Catholic community.

35E95FBF69324B668E78FB2A23BE7829.description:
The Cardinal Virtues of Temperance, Justice, Fortitude and Prudence make it possible to respond effectively to the
Theological Virtues.

2910A00E7F9446458CB94AD3AE7551C9.description:
The Theological Virtues are Faith, Hope and Charity (Love). They are keys to develop the attitude necessary to live a life in
keeping with the Gospel and the commands of Jesus.

E87D232CC0FC4435815AB585A35AA66A.description:
PRECEPTS, GOOD WORKS, AND VIRTUES HELP. TO STRENGTHEN THE FAITHFUL IN LIVING HOLY LIVES AND DOING GOOD
WORKS.

F3D57AE789CE44819540F7CA5F7BCDAE.description:
Mortal sin is knowingly and willingly choosing to do something that is gravely contrary to God's law. It is a serious, deliberate
failure in one's love and respect for God, one's neighbor,
creation and oneself.

C0156B0031934961AEE79EA63D4700BB.description: Venial sins do not break one's relationship with God, but they weaken it.

51E1C943BBE242728102F976B612AAD7.description:
Any deliberate thought, word, deed or omission against God's
law is a sin. Sin is a personal act for which a person is responsible. Personal Sin is to be distinguished from Original
Sin.

022CAE43D38F49569E0CA9B052D15A56.description:
As a consequence of Original Sin man lost the grace of original holiness, and became subject to the law of death; sin became
universally present in the world. Human nature is described as
being in a fallen state.

AD516EDE851F42619EC842C2E3C72A04.description: The morality of human acts depends on: the object chosen; the end in view or the intention; and the circumstances of the action.

046A9BCF91694F4B933B7F659ED7CCE9.description:
HUMANS, HAVING.BEEN WOUNDED IN NATURE BY ORIGINAL SIN, ARE SUBJECT TO IGNORANCE, SUFFERING AND THE
DOMINION OF DEATH; AND INCLINED TO SIN - AN INCLINATION TO EVIL CALLED CONCUPISCENCE

AC39509342B348489149F24E09544AE4.description:
Grace is the free and undeserved gift from God by which Christians are united with him and empowered to love him.
There are four kinds of grace: sanctifying, actual, sacramental
and charisms {the grace of one's state of life).

DAA50421B0DA447CA2EB2EF4C30121EC.description:
Free will and intellect, or reason, make people responsible for
their actions to live a moral life.

63E0374DDFD04505B2AB1292BA7BA5BC.description:
The grace of Christ is the gratuitous gift that God makes to us of his own life, infused by the Holy Spirit into our soul to heal it of sin and to
sanctify it. It is the sanctifying or deifying grace received in Baptism.

351D6A09E2DC46DAB1AD26A05A2E57B6.description: GOD'S GRACE PRECEDES, PREPARES AND DRAWS OUT A PERSON'S FREE WILL; GRACE PERFECTS ONE'S FREE WILL.

BE9D81D4C8A14FABBEFD8D3A824CD763.description: Each person must will to repent and be saved. By acknowledging faults, the human person asks to share in Jesus Christ's mercy. Actively participating in the sacraments leads the faithful to true conversion and correct moral decision making.

7F60FB90C26D4EB5BADDA59876BD279D.description: Through the Church's administering of the sacraments, Jesus Christ continues to reach out to sinners and offers redemption to all.

05030C33F73C48288AD8BFE079BA6010.description: TO BE MORAL MEANS TO TURN AWAY FROM SIN AND COOPERATE WITH GOD'S GRACE IN EXERCISING ONE'S FREE WILL.

FA77AFF1DA36448C9C7AAD16969A7AB7.description:
Just as a covenant is a sacred relationship between God and a human being, sacramental marriage mirrors that covenant
through exclusive and faithful love.

6CE0881E76254114A4A1BD1CC3629E06.description:
The Church teaches that the equality of all people rests
essentially on their dignity as persons and principles of Social Justice flow from this truth. Social Justice principles must
address issues of age, physical and mental abilities and
benefits that come from social commerce and distribution of
wealth.

9B1D94CBA3BA438ABC4B7B99671D5DDF.description:
The Church's teachings with respect to the dignity of the human person maintain that the rights of the human person are prior to
society. Cultural influences must always be evaluated in this
light.

A9718D8CCEDC4C14A3D8612C48F03711.description:
ALL HUMAN LIFE IS SACRED AND HAS DIGNITY FROM CONCEPTION TO NATURAL DEATH. CATHOLICS ARE CALLED TO
PROTECT THE DIGNITY OF THE HUMAN PERSON FROM SUCH THREATS AS ABORTION, POVERTY, SUICIDE, EUTHANASIA,
DEATH PENAL TY, ETC.

205BA9EDE28B4CF0AEA744E60FB469D7.description:
The Church's moral and social teachings must guide the People of God in every age and each person must assume responsibility for
acts performed. The Church's teaching reflects culture in each era of
history.

475CC294964B41CB9F70F5AD9B3E96FE.description:
THE CHURCH'S MORAL AND SOCIAL TEACHINGS ARE ROOTED IN THE FUNDAMENTAL PRINCIPLE OF THE SACREDNESS
OF EVERY PERSON.

E91532ACCBDC4F7FA54D4474DD85889E.description: The Magisterium of the Church teaches and interprets the moral choices for the faithful. It is ordinarily exercised through catechesis and preaching.

3FBAA6F0569246799CAF28FB505E97EE.description: The pastoral duty of the Magisterium is aimed at seeing that the People of God abide in the Truth that liberates.

1F8FCD41E8554D9AA0A5D9952D25F44D.description: THE MAGISTERIUM IS THE CHURCH'S AUTHENTIC TEACHER IN MATTERS OF MORALITY

F570ACBA7E1B4FD4B13DABC394C8E227.description:
Throughout the history of the Church, Sacred Tradition has aided the faithful in understanding and discerning the right judgments of
conscience.

0F61E06725464B0EB052834F177CF261.description:
SACRED TRADITION, AS THE LIVING TRANSMISSION OF GOD'S TRUTH TO THE CHURCH, SERVES TO HELP PEOPLE
THROUGH THE GUIDANCE OF THE HOLY SPIRIT, TO KNOW HOW TO LISTEN TO AND RESPOND TO GOD IN PRAYER AND IN
OUR DECISIONS.

A6742CA01C04487BA5832418E00A1975.description: The faithful must continue throughout a lifetime to develop a formed conscience according to the Word of God and guidance of the Holy Spirit. Right judgment requires the faithful to listen to God's truth and practice virtue.

F017327E3E32409B81641679B9F92D1B.description:
THROUGH PRAYER AND STUDY A GOOD CONSCIENCE REQUIRES LIFELONG FORMATION SHAPED BY THE COMMUNITY
OF FAITH, THE MAGISTERIUM AND THE WORD OF GOD.

D37D99BBA5DA4B2196B51C61B005417A.description: Conscience is a judgment of reason by which the human person recognizes the moral quality of a concrete act.

56239F81292C4CD5B070D2328928D1A9.description: CONSCIENCE IS THE MOST BASIC AWARENESS OF RIGHT AND WRONG.

AABD8FA0FA5643B5911AFF7434A8BD9E.description:
The natural law is written and engraved in the soul of each and every person, because it is human reason ordaining to do good and
forbidding the person to sin. The New Law is the grace of the Holy
Spirit received by faith in Christ, operating through charity.

DCB7C52F04D04F9EBC05D17BFD7B359E.description:
NATURAL LAW IS THE PART OF MORAL LAW THAT IS ACCESSIBLE TO ALL PEOPLE THROUGH THE USE OF REASON
REFLECTING ON THE NATURE OF WHAT IS TO BE HUMAN. IT REMAINS VALID IN ALL TIMES AND PLACES.

BCE07664DDB440B09CC1F5D767621CA3.description: The "Golden Rule" is relational since each person is called to treat others with respect, dignity, and love as each person  would expect to be treated by others.

2C9818BA1DAC445693710DAF60F94CBC.description:
CHRISTIANS ARE CALLED TO FOLLOW THE "GOLDEN RULE": DO UNTO OTHERS AS YOU WOULD HAVE THEM DO UNTO
YOU.

B8060977315E47C28A98397B1714F098.description:
"You shall love the Lord, your God, with all your heart, with all
your soul, and with all your mind." This is the greatest and the first commandment. The second is like it: "You shall love your
neighbor as yourself. The whole law and the prophets depend
on these two commandments."

4E1D130F0F7B4AB7B55829FFA110B6F6.description:
TRUE CHRISTIAN HAPPINESS IS BASED ON THE GREAT COMMANDMENT: TO LOVE ABOVE ALL ELSE THE TRUE GOD AS
REVEALED IN JESUS CHRIST AND TO LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR AS YOURSELF.

61F1EE63BA5B4C8CB4A7DC739883F53A.description: The Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes help the faithful make choices and live out daily situations.

025383C4D45341A294825E94051C00CA.description: THE JEN COMMANDMENTS AND THE BEATITUDES FORM THE FOUNDATION FOR A MORAL LIFE.

3398904A22F743D094DD9DB2BAC6114D.description:
Respect for the human person considers the other "another self." It presupposes respect for the dignity intrinsic of the person. Solidarity
is an eminently Christian virtue. It practices the sharing of spiritual
goods even more than material ones.

1CB2A1031F084D97A3542808AE7E1576.description:
There is a difference between freedom in law and freedom from law for freedom is the power to act or not to act, and so to perform
deliberate acts of one's own. Freedom attains perfection in its acts
when directed toward God, the sovereign Good.

5DAC4B7B256C4A98A326001965D0E839.description: LIVING THE COMMANDMENT TO LOVE STRENGTHENS THE COMMON GOOD OF ALL THE MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.

5EE8CF337EA1475F8AC0E60D2E1F9955.description: To live as a disciple of Jesus Christ one must use him as the example of a full and moral life.

9038B862FB5D48269A9D8E31A710809B.description: GOD REVEALS HIS COMMANDMENT TO LOVE THROUGH THE EXAMPLE OF JESUS CHRIST LIFE AND MINISTRY.

A9BA18D56A0A4473A811C311318EC386.description: Faith Theme: Morality/ Our Life in Christ

8ECF99D49C0646E58FE52CBC400F5C5F.description:
Martyrs witness to the truth of the faith. The martyr endures
even death to be faithful to Jesus Christ.

E377B052DD5E4180A7E0BFF2AF135716.description:
Saints are models of discipleship, the "holy one" who leads life in union with God through grace of Jesus Christ and receives
the reward of eternal life.

6F2460353FEB4BE3A9CA7F08A27BCFC0.description:
Within the history of the Church, we are given many unique individuals whose lives model for us the Universal Call to
Holiness.

DD458B2E9CD048A98E5AD13AE57A4BAD.description:
IN THE HISTORY OF TH.E PEOPLE OF GOD, "FHERE HAVE BEEN MANY TRIALS AND TRIUMPHS THAT SHAPE OUR IDENTITY
AS THE CHURCH.

437E0D4340FD486AA6AC840A718C7FB4.description: The Catholic Church has four marks. It is One, Holy, Catholic, and Apostolic. Each mark has an essential meaning for the Church and its mission.

DC8EF110E14444F19E7203968EF2CA1D.description: THE CATHOLIC CHURCH IS RECOGNIZED BY FOUR MARKS.

434C9615185047D38B87C52EF15EB3F9.description:
The Bishops, as successors of the Apostles, have the authority
and duty to teach, govern and sanctify the People of God.

ED6F8BE4515B4AA1B895D31B97E81F9B.description: THE SUCCESSORS OF THE APOSTLES, THE BISHOPS, ARE GIVEN THREE AUTHORITIES.

EDEE48F80C5D44149317E40EBDDA4A35.description:
The divinely instituted ecclesiastical ministry is exercised in different degrees by those who even from ancient times have been called bishops, priests, and deacons. Two degrees of ministerial participation in the priesthood of Christ are the episcopacy and the presbyterate. The diaconate is intended to
help serve them.

5180CF01FEE04613BB322AC767B5DC4B.description: THE CHURCH IS HIERARCHICAL IN STRUCTURE

792412CDB370442DB19A494D321CEA9C.description: Infallibility is the gift of the Holy Spirit to the Church whereby the pope, pastor of the Church and bishops in union with him, can definitively proclaim a doctrine of faith or morals for the belief of the faithful.

D02937C4DD234213BDCC68CBF74F35B1.description: The authority of Peter as Pope is handed to his successors throughout the Church's history.

72C72951FEDA4CCF87CAC78A7CEE04E3.description:
Apostolic Fathers are always timely witnesses in the Tradition, as
they help to transmit the faith, guided by the Holy Spirit.

1840BFEB054B445DB4BAB65650BD8756.description:
An Apologist is an early Church Father who wrote or preached in
defense of the faith.

456209431BD74031B0A34431048F551E.description: Apostolic succession is the handing on of apostolic preaching and authority from the Apostles to their successors the bishops through the laying on of hands, as a permanent office in the  Church.

11B6E3296C0C4F89A65BCDC077BCE385.description:
THE TEACHING AUTHORITY OF THE CHURCH WAS GIVEN TO THE APOSTLES BY JESUS CHRIST AND HANDED DOWN
THROUGH APOSTOLIC SUCCESSION.

4E7017615D55481FBED7473A2D5866F3.description: The day of Pentecost has Jewish roots as the Feast of Weeks, a holy day to be observed by the Jews.

B15A2C5E5E6C4BE88976B7239AFFD67F.description: Pentecost is important in salvation history because it is the beginning of the Church's ministry which has continued through the guidance of the Holy Spirit in the Magisterium, salvation.

2B8067131E694E42B0AC191652A5DECE.description: The Holy Spirit is the third divine Person of the Blessed Trinity, the personal love of Father and Son for each other.

406D9226F6DE4B7ABD3568CF4041D096.description: PENTECOST IS THE FEAST ON WHICH THE HOLY SPIRIT WAS REVEALED TO THE PEOPLE OF GOD.

1BA321D2D9434F20ABBE367B4FF1EEBE.description: In the early church different ministries grew out of the communal life.

C7BD71E665D14B9FB18CDD9AA7E4B18A.description:
The primacy held by Saint Peter in the early church is evidenced in
the Acts of the Apostles.

15F8270AC8C448758EEF30CD923A409A.description:
In the Acts of the Apostles the communal life of the baptized was expressed in devotion to the teachings of the apostles,
breaking bread, and in prayers.

319F8A26A7DE4CD2A76256AA2B77083C.description: THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES TELL-1iHE STORY OF THE EARLY CHURCH.

3F95294854E245E1A5FE6AD15EF15D98.description: Sacred Scripture and Apostolic Tradition are modes of Divine Revelation. The task of interpretation has been entrusted to the  bishops in communion with the successor of Peter, the Bishop of Rome (the Pope).

A5112277E6E745C1B3E97D5C2443FBC9.description: Sacred Tradition comes from the apostles and is to be distinguished from the various theological, disciplinary, liturgical, or devotional traditions born in the local churches  over time.

FCEE206169AA40B0A658B55EA9E658A1.description:
ONE OF THE WAYS IN WHICH GOD HAS BEEN REVEALED IS THROUGH THE SACRED HISTORY OF GOD'S PEOPLE AND
THROUGH SACRED·TRADITION.

5C5CA2A3ACE74508BF4A82246183F3D3.description:
We are all called to participate in the proclamation of Jesus Christ and his Gospel by word and testimony of life, in
fulfillment of his command.

9A831B96A0E146289425B6E88BBCF9AF.description:
The Kingdom Of God (Of Heaven) is the reign or rule of God. It is the righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit, of
which Jesus Christ gave to his Apostles for the work of
proclaiming the Kingdom.

317C15B5E2FA4331993EE5D42C959633.description:
IT IS THE MISSION OF THE CHURCH TO CONTINUE TO BUILD THE KINGDOM OF GOD AND SPREAD THE GOSPEL TO THE
WORLD.

DBE6DCD5007F40A1A16626C0B8E0CF9F.description: The community of the Trinity is the model for the community of the Church.

4A02D0185F2F4A7A9A3AF0C0CF837D66.description: The Church continues in response to Jesus' call of the Apostles, with Peter as head. The popes as successors of Peter, the Magisterium as successors of the Apostles, and all the laity, continue spreading the Good News.

44BC3CC890C14D1EB6BDFD4CDB331176.description: JESUS, IN RESPONSE TO THE FATHER'S PLAN OF SALVATION,. INSTITUTED THE CHURCH THROUGH HIS GIFT OF SELF.

B8500FF311CB47AE93EB55EF85CA8C9D.description: A diversity of members in the various parishes are engaged in building up Christ's Body. While their functions (roles) maybe different they are all a part of the Body of Christ.

922EEBFD33094FD98ECB055BF2C73310.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE HEAD OF A BODY, THE CHURCH.

CB28914A10A04C88AA53578C6062A05B.description: Jesus Christ is the center of salvation history. God has revealed himself fully by sending his own Son, in whom he has established his covenant forever. The Son is his Father's definitive Word; so there will be no further Revelation after him.

B7373B44B80A44C1BAB13414377DF0BF.description: The Incarnation is the fact that the Son of God assumed human nature and became man in order to accomplish our salvation in that same human nature. Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the second Person of the Trinity, is both true God and true man, not part God and part man.

33F9E88EBF4A4F038A7A08135A5EBB0B.description: JESUS CHRIST, THE WORD OF GOD, FOR THE SALVATION;OF THE WORLD, BECAME FLESH AND DWELT AMONG MANKIND.

608EFAE0F69A42AB80A20B003C2B5FD4.description: Faith Theme: The People of God.

2BBD85F200B14CA7A4FF06068B2FEDB3.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those in need through the
Corporal and Spiritual Works of Mercy.

BE6C4003028E43D3872A738D1E630E31.description: The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to model our lives.

2406D130DC854C918AFEB9C2B062E9EC.description: The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the New Covenant.

AC36755A855C4D168633A969597D2502.description: JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS

E985A8B4D3FC445EADCEFF0E0188A932.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and help 
the faithful to lead lives directed towards Jesus Christ.

5128F5A431BC40E79C1E301CE8683549.description: The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday Eucharistic Celebration, the central liturgical action of the faithful.

2218DF4AC18C4BEEAD6C8ECCA6F64C86.description: The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to sanctify our days.

0ABB58A130B6479096EEC85B8D83A861.description:
The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work and
prayer of the Liturgy of the Hours. The Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of the 
Church, prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

10254F0BEFC74FE1B8288E4CF84D8861.description: LITURGY IS THE• PUBUC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THE CHURCH.

744865285C4D47D7A54F2F4975CEECC7.description:
The precepts of the Church are standards that Catholics observe to live a Christian life in 
the Catholic community.

9C2CC3AC4FD14C05AC3EBB65341FF6B3.description:
The Cardinal Virtues of Temperance, Justice, Fortitude and Prudence make it possible to 
respond effectively to the Theological Virtues.

ED360AA63CE94C0A84A6F5AE577A6C09.description:
The Theological Virtues are Faith, Hope and Charity (Love). They are keys to develop the 
attitude necessary to live a life in keeping with the Gospel and the commands of Jesus.

AAB0D0CC40F44001B37B0A39606526CB.description:
PRECEPTS, GOOD WORKS, AND VIRTUES HELP. TO STRENGTHEN.THE FAITHFUL IN LIVING HOLY LIVES AND DOING GOOD
WORKS.

3944E649BE924C2D951608A83180BF68.description: Mortal sin is knowingly and willingly choosing to do something that is gravely contrary to God's law. It is a serious, deliberate failure in one's love and respect for God, one's neighbor, creation and oneself.

F594D30C1449467392BFCCD6A576F84A.description: Venial sins do not break one's relationship with God, but they weaken it.

E52E94C4A8EB45E0AB8DFD02ACD650C2.description: Any deliberate thought, word, deed or omission against God's law is a sin. Sin is a personal act for which a person is responsible. Personal Sin is to be distinguished from Original Sin.

581AD732ECDC43D4B0E474A247C16C5C.description:
As a consequence of Original Sin man lost the grace of original holiness, and became subject to the law of death; sin became universally present in the world. Human nature is 
described as being in a fallen state.

FCB77FDCEA6343428946AED2926555FC.description: Grace is the free and undeserved gift from God by which Christians are united with him and empowered to love him. There are four kinds of grace: sanctifying, actual, sacramental and charisms (the grace of one's state in life).

D8022CF8FBF14858841A8A87A8095D85.description: Free will and intellect, or reason, make people responsible for their actions to live a moral  life.

9FD0B30CDC5541369E3C93F434419594.description: GOD'S GRACE PRECEDES, PREPARES AND DRAWS OUT A PERSON'S FREE WILL; GRACE PERFECTS ONE'S FREE WILL

0E90E1E52E50440A927ECE722FEAD4D3.description:
Just as a covenant is a sacred relationship between God and a human being, sacramental 
marriage mirrors that covenant through exclusive and faithful love.

F52B62083ACA4B89AA99265AF8BA32D1.description:
The Church teaches that the equality of all people rests essentially on their dignity as
persons and principles of Social Justice flow from this truth. Social Justice principles must 
address issues of age, physical and mental abilities and benefits that come from social 
commerce and distribution of wealth.

8BE07590077143FAB91BD9CBF6029A5E.description:
The Church's teachings with respect to the dignity of the human person maintain that the 
rights of the human person are prior to society. Cultural influences must always be evaluated in this light.

77DCAB9BCDAC44E08D8C2BB02E6468BD.description:
ALL HUMAN LIFE IS SACRED AND HAS DIGNITY FROM CONCEPTION TO NATURAL DEATH. CATHOLICS ARE CALLED TO
PROTECT THE DIGNITY OF THE HUMAN PERSON FROM SUCH THREATS AS ABORTION, POVERTY, SUICIDE, EUTHANASIA,
DEATH PENAL TY, ETC.

A08EDB8C86FF4D76A5ED9A69310D781E.description: The faithful must continue throughout a lifetime to develop a formed conscience according to the Word of God and guidance of the Holy Spirit. Right judgment requires the faithful to listen to God's truth and practice virtue.

8AD3704A9D7849E0A88DA61D557CAACB.description:
THROUGH PRAYER AND STUDY A GOOD CONSCIENCE REQUIRES LIFELONG FORMATION SHAPED BY THE COMMUNITY OF
FAITH, THE MAGISTERIUM AND THE WORD OF GOD.

145E8313361E4604BEBFBD41CFB0ADC2.description:
Conscience is a judgment of reason by which the human person recognizes the moral 
quality of a concrete act.

A7BCF7A1FC7741BE87C48158E8AE59F1.description: CONSCIENCE IS THE MOST BASIC AWARENESS OF RIGHT AND WRONG.

A28FCD4162EC4EACBAB353C43DC5624B.description: The "Golden Rule" is relational since each person is called to treat others with respect, 3.1.1 dignity, and love as each person would expect to be treated by others.

2C0ADEECEBBA4F7C90CA85BF590E40D5.description:
CHRISTIANS ARE CALLED TO FOLLOW THE "GOLDEN RULE": DO UNTO OTHERS AS YOU WOULD HAVE THEM DO UNTO
YOU.

AAF036A75EF94F84AB4FF2B6ADDFC8AE.description:
"You shall love the Lord, your God, with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your
mind." This is the greatest and the first commandment. The second is like it: "You shall love 
your neighbor as yourself. The whole law and the prophets depend on these two 
commandments."

956C6FBE6ADF492C94DF02ACA2C7F825.description:
TRUE CHRISTIAN HAPPINESS IS BASED ON THE GREAT COMMANDMENT: TO LOVE ABOVE ALL ELSE THE TRUE GOD AS
REVEALED IN JESUS CHRIST AND TO LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR AS YOURSELF.

6E9797604D534C8787EB6BD355FB4F43.description:
The Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes help the faithful make choices and live out 
daily situations.

DC0C0C6DC23D413D8F64B5603860BD37.description: THE TEN COMMANDMENTS AND THE BEATITUDES FORM THE FOUNDATION FOR A MORAL LIFE.

905A7670143C449C8F94DEE3B3EB78BC.description: To live as a disciple of Jesus Christ one must use him as the example of a full and moral life.

CA143FD5D8A24E1A9B472ECC6DEBF9C4.description: GOD REVEALS HIS COMMANDMENT TO1LOVE THROUGH EXAMPLE OF JESUS CHRIST LIFE AND MINISTRY.

10869FF579FE4C6792A1D587321ED309.description: Martyrs witness to the truth of the faith. The martyr endures even death to be faithful to Jesus Christ.

BF890DE5AC2D4C519A320D9555EB19D0.description: Saints are models of discipleship, the "holy one" who leads life in union with God through grace of Jesus Christ and receives the reward of eternal life.

7C5D0D8EB3704873A605A6F6117A8D42.description: Within the history of the Church, we are given many unique individuals whose lives model for us the Universal Call to Holiness.

606BF6C38FA24DAF892A54AEF74FAC73.description:
IN THE HISTORY OF THE PEOPLE OF GOD, THERE HAVE BEEN MANY TRIALS AND TRIUMPHS THAT SHAPE OUR IDENTITY
AS THE CHURCH.

1A521D37957E45B8BFA835CAB688E8A7.description: The Catholic Church has four marks. It is One, Holy, Catholic, and Apostolic. Each mark has an essential meaning for the Church and its mission.

1563D1EFD35D4DF1851879CB1EA2CCAE.description: THE CATHOLIC CHURCH IS RECOGNIZED BY FOUR MARKS.

476CBC892DCD4673AAF69443F3B9ED35.description: The Bishops, as successors of the Apostles, have the authority and duty to teach, govern and sanctify the People of God.

99C2CC74A9504290925F800B1CE70EA2.description: THE SUCCESSORS OF THE APOSTLES, THE BISHOPS, ARE GIVEN THREE AUTHORITIES.

EBD0087F333E44209D47C98B43B359F9.description: The divinely instituted ecclesiastical ministry is exercised in different degrees by those who even from ancient times have been called bishops, priests, and deacons. Two degrees of ministerial participation in the priesthood of Christ are the episcopacy and the presbyterate. The diaconate is intended to help serve them.

2A1AFDB096654F12AA98DFDEA6375F2D.description: THE CHURCH IS HIERARCHICAL IN STRUCTURE.

6EB89793FA444B67AB1DC718F2F562B4.description: Infallibility is the gift of the Holy Spirit to the Church whereby the pope, pastor of the Church, and bishops in union with him, can definitively proclaim a doctrine of faith or morals for the belief of the faithful.

7ECB67B923D04C88806644D5196484C0.description: The authority of Peter as Pope is handed to his successors throughout the Church's history.

E0D6FB7DD48541EAB403FE677CC0725B.description: Apostolic succession is the handing on of apostolic preaching and authority from the Apostles to their successors the bishops through the laying on of hands, as a permanent office in the Church.

934E62B8F4464E33B97565F13B8A807A.description:
THE TEACHING AUTHORITY OF THE CHURCH WAS GIVEN TO THE APOSTLES BY JESUS CHRIST AND HANDED DOWN
THROUGH APOSTOLIC SUCCESSION.

FA20D908C16843FC9E850600AE2AB13B.description:
The day of Pentecost has Jewish roots as the Feast of Weeks, a holy day to be observed by
the Jews.

4124ECA941234D178F6C12DD8E73322C.description: Pentecost is important in salvation history because it is the beginning of the Church's ministry which has continued through the guidance of the Holy Spirit in the Magisterium, liturgy, in the witness of the saints, and in the whole work of salvation.

1EB93199F52B4D338D1E02535330BDB0.description: The Holy Spirit is the third divine Person of the Blessed Trinity, the personal love of Father and Son for each other.

19BFDDB84D28454E91634229AFABE179.description: PENTECOST IS THE FEAST ON WHICH THE HOLY SPIRIT WAS REVEALED TO THE PEOPLE OF GOD.

69101D417A564F578F45CF936A7FE75F.description: In the Acts of the Apostles the communal life of the baptized was expressed in devotion to the teachings of the apostles, breaking bread, and in prayers.

0A172D75C6B84B789EC0DC72EB333242.description: THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES TELL THE STORY OF THE EARLY CHURCH.

F2F1DF1FD78E4B18A3299CAA6C69D8C6.description: Sacred Scripture and Apostolic Tradition are modes of Divine Revelation. The task of interpretation has been entrusted to the bishops in communion with the successor of Peter, the Bishop of Rome (the Pope).

CCEE6866FF3F4C0F97DC1EEA972BEC28.description: Sacred Tradition comes from the apostles and is to be distinguished from the various theological, disciplinary, liturgical, or devotional traditions born in the local churches over time.

7D9C9FD3529345958F2B8AC2281E2EE0.description:
ONE OF THE WAYS IN WHICH GOD HAS BEEN REVEALED IS THROUGH THE SACRED HISTORY OF GOD'S PEOPLE AND
THROUGH SACRED TRADITION.

FA6C2849309649808E97FAADFFF0742C.description: We are all called to participate in the proclamation of Jesus Christ and his Gospel by word and testimony of life, in fulfillment of his command.

366CF2FA628E4C3983CF2D521DBE7E36.description: The Kingdom Of God (Of Heaven} is the reign or rule of God. It is the righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit, of which Jesus Christ gave to his Apostles for the work of proclaiming the Kingdom.

5B63A81F58D14632A102FDD91AD62EBF.description:
IT IS THE MISSION OF THE CHURCH TO CONTINUE TO BUILD THE KINGDOM OF GOD AND SPREAD T.HE GOSPEL TO THE
WORLD.

EAF4A5183341433DA192287C339ABDA2.description: The community of the Trinity is the model for the community of the Church.

ACD6D14393F54C999A5D011CF887E103.description: The Church continues in response to Jesus' call of the Apostles, with Peter as head. The popes as successors of Peter, the Magisterium as successors of the Apostles, and all the laity, continue spreading the Good News.

54B6125143DC4C0D9668FF53F02EE9A7.description: JESUS, IN RESPONSE TO THE FATHER'S PLAN OF SALVATION, INSTITUTED THE CHURCH THROUGH HIS GIFT OF SELF.

7D9842C489374D44833C97E5EDBE44BD.description: A diversity of members in the various parishes are engaged in building up Christ's Body. While their functions (roles} maybe different they are all a part of the Body of Christ.

D2E47A51D652483B8C4AAAF4C57E9838.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE HEAD OF A BODY, THE CHURCH.

83FD04323A3A4A5F8E9BCC903A672AE5.description: The Incarnation is the fact that the Son of God assumed human nature and became man in order to accomplish our salvation in that same human nature. Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the second Person of the Trinity, is both true God and true man, not part God and part man.

31B354A3ABE04DC5837E8C2B5C5164B3.description: JESUS CHRIST, THE WORD OF GOD, FOR THE SALVATION OF THE WORLD, BECAME FLESH AND DWELT AMONG US.
